meanings.definition: To cover a surface with a pattern of geometric shapes that fit together without any gaps.
meanings.sent1: I will tessellate the floor with square tiles.
meanings.sent2: Artists often tessellate shapes to create interesting patterns.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces tessellated perfectly, forming a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to tessellate seamlessly, forming a clear plan.
meanings.sent5: The colorful blocks tessellated like a vibrant mosaic on the wall.

meanings.definition: A pattern of geometric shapes that fit together without any gaps.
meanings.sent1: The tessellate on the wall was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The quilt had a lovely tessellate of triangles and squares.
meanings.sent3: The tessellate of clouds in the sky looked like a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The city streets formed a tessellate of buildings and roads.
meanings.sent5: The garden path had a beautiful tessellate of colorful stones.
